data_structures: 3D DP table (optimized to 2 rows for space)
algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming. dp[i][j][char_idx] stores LPS length ending with char_idx for s[i...j].
problem_summary_simple: Find the longest palindromic subsequence with even length and no adjacent equal characters (except middle).
problem_summary_technical: DP state dp[i][j][char_idx] for LPS of s[i...j] ending with char_idx. Transitions consider matching outer characters and inner LPS.
key_insights: The constraint of no consecutive equal characters (except middle) requires tracking the last character of the subsequence.
The DP state needs to store the length of the longest palindromic subsequence ending with a specific character.
The problem can be viewed as finding the longest palindromic subsequence of even length, with an additional constraint on adjacent characters.
